intro: Daviesia nematophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or red flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It is typically found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Daviesia nematophylla is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to various conditions.
